intro: Disciphania remota, commonly known as the remote disciphania, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are opposite and often have a hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Disciphania remota is often found in woodland areas and thrives in moist, well-drained soils.
